name: HTML & CSS Fundamentals
description: Learn the essential building blocks of web development by mastering HTML and CSS. Build beautiful, responsive websites from scratch.
whatYouLearn: Understand the Box Model and layout techniques
Use Flexbox and Grid for responsive design
Build a complete web page from scratch

exercises.title: Styling with CSS
exercises.description: Use CSS to change colors, fonts, and spacing of your web elements.
exercises.theory: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) controls the appearance of HTML elements. You can add CSS inline, internally using <style>, or externally through a .css file. The syntax uses selectors and property-value pairs.

exercises.title: Understanding the Box Model
exercises.description: Explore how padding, border, and margin affect the layout of elements.
exercises.theory: The CSS Box Model consists of content, padding, border, and margin. It defines how much space an element occupies. Use 'padding' for inner space, 'border' for edge thickness, and 'margin' for outer spacing.

exercises.title: Building a Simple Web Page
exercises.description: Combine HTML and CSS to create a complete, styled webpage.
exercises.theory: A web page typically combines HTML structure with external CSS for consistent styling. The goal is to create a visually appealing, well-structured page.
